item.title: Bootstrapping the Galera cluster
item.description:
In order to bootstrap your Galera cluster, manually bring up the cluster IP address on the desired interface. In this example, we’ll use 192.168.122.99 and eth1:

ip address add 192.168.122.99/24 dev eth1 label eth1:galera

And initialize the Galera cluster:

item.title: Setting Galera-specific MySQL options
item.description:
Now you can proceed with setting Galera specifics in your MySQL configurations.

Create a configuration file, identical on all cluster nodes, named /etc/mysql/conf.d/galera.cnf with the following content:

[mysqld]
bind_address=0.0.0.0
binlog_format=ROW
default_storage_engine=InnoDB
innodb_autoinc_lock_mode=2
innodb_locks_unsafe_for_binlog=1
